intro.title: Project Introduction
intro.desc: Gowlive is an open-source live streaming recording tool designed to provide users with convenient and efficient solutions for recording live content. It is suitable for scenarios where you need to save, review, or analyze live content for learning and communication. We encourage developers and enthusiasts to collaboratively improve features and enhance user experience.
intro.security: This project is for learning and technical exchange only. Do not use it for any commercial purposes or any behavior that infringes on the rights of others.

greeting.morning: Good morning, {nickname}! Have a great day!
greeting.noon: Good noon, {nickname}! Eat well and have a good rest!
greeting.afternoon: Good afternoon, {nickname}! Keep up the good work and stay in a good mood!
greeting.evening: Good evening, {nickname}! Relax after a long day!
greeting.night: It's late, sleep tight and have a sweet dream. Good night~

help.title: FAQ
help.desc: Here are some frequently asked questions.

faqs.question: About Monitoring Types
faqs.answer: Smart monitoring dynamically adjusts polling intervals based on live status, history, and metrics. For high real-time requirements, it's recommended to enable real-time monitoring. If the broadcast time is fixed, scheduled monitoring is suggested.

faqs.question: About Monitoring Quantity
faqs.answer: Currently, no stress tests have been performed, so there is no valid data on the maximum number of concurrent monitors per platform.

faqs.question: About Monitoring Metrics
faqs.answer: Monitoring metrics collect live request data within a five-minute window. A global alert is triggered when abnormal metrics appear.

faqs.question: Live Stream URL Format
faqs.answer: Only web live room URLs are supported for now, for example: https://live.platform.com/xxxxxx

faqs.question: Homepage URL Format
faqs.answer: Only web anchor homepage URLs are supported for now, for example: https://www.platform.com/user/xxxxxx

faqs.question: About Video Playback
About Recording Formats
faqs.answer: MKV/TS: Resilient to power loss, easy to repair; FLV: Low overhead, continuous writing; MP4: Feature-rich, not resilient to power loss.
